Introduction

Minkyeung, formerly known as Roa, is a South Korean former K-pop idol, songwriter, composer, currently an model and actress under KPLUS. She was the leader of the girl group HINAPIA and a former member of the girl group PRISTIN and its sub-unit PRISTIN V.

In 2016, Minkyung participated in Mnet's survival television show, Produce 101, along with other five trainees from her agency, Pledis Entertainment. She was eliminated in episode 8 after ranking 42nd place.

In 2017, Pledis Entertainment announced Minkyung, under the stage name Roa, as a member of PRISTIN, which debuted on March 21, 2017 with the mini album "Hi!" and its title track, "Wee Woo".

On 24 October, 2022 Minkyeung signed an exclusive contract with KPLUS. She plans to be active in the fashion, beauty and acting industries.

Fun facts

1
Minkyeung appeared in NU'EST's "Daybreak" Music Video.
…
2
Minkyeung's former stage name "Roa" is a combination of ‘ro’ (which means ‘smile’) and ‘a’ (‘beautiful’), which means becoming a person with a beautiful smile.

Minkyeung was a backup dancer in Orange Caramel’s “My Copycat” MV.

Minkyeung loves cooking.
